qas.question: What is the game between the rivals Barcelona and Real Madrid called?
What basic difference is there between the teams of Barcelona and Real Madrid?
What areas of Spain do the teams of Barcelona and Real Madrid represent?
What kind of tensions are the two teams viewed as displaying?
Besides the areas of Spain, what other differences are there between Barcelona and Real Madrid?

context: There is often a fierce rivalry between the two strongest teams in a national league, and this is particularly the case in La Liga, where the game between Barcelona and Real Madrid is known as <a0_0>El Clásico<a0_0/>. From the start of national competitions the clubs were seen as representatives of two <a1_0>rival regions<a1_0/> in Spain: <a2_0>Catalonia and Castile<a2_0/>, as well as of the <a4_0>two cities<a4_0/>. The rivalry reflects what many regard as the <a3_0>political and cultural<a3_0/> tensions felt between Catalans and the Castilians, seen by one author as a re-enactment of the Spanish Civil War.
